name: places/ChIJT3elHaH2wokRt8S0JS3bml4
formattedAddress: 812 W 181st St #2, New York, NY 10033, USA
adrFormatAddress: 812 W 181st St #2, New York, NY 10033-4543, USA

originalText.text:
I hesitated leaving a bad review for a long time. My husband and I used to drop off a lot clothes here. It started off great but there were incidents here and there as time went by and they increasingly started charging insane prices like $70 a jacket.

It was one of this down jackets that I left and they completely RUINED it. They had obviously washed it in a normal machine when I had paid the very overpriced cost of $70 for a dry clean (never ever requested other services). I know this because I received the jacked WET and STINKY since it was a real down and they did not even dry it properly. Not only did the ruin the down, they also ruined all of the enamel coated buttons.. they were all scraped. Mind you this jacket was new (only a month of wear) and very expensive.

I let them know the issues when I picked it up and they “dry-cleaned” it again yet to ruin it even more. To this day, I’ve brought it to another place (they charged $30) and I’ve tried airing it out but it still stinks. I cannot wear the jacket anymore.

I really felt robbed and taken advantage of. I trusted them with so many of my clothes I loved which they never cleaned properly…the jacket was my last straw. Completely dissapointed of this place and I always gave them the benefit of the doubt because they’re family owned.. I’m honestly sad to leave this review but I cannot wish another person go through such terrible service.

originalText.text: Horrible service! I dropped over 5 very expensive cashmere sweaters here and they somehow managed to shrink all of them. When I inquired about what happened or tried to figure out what methods they use, they were unable to give me any straight answers. I believe they throw everything in the washing machines here and then try their best to make things look better by steaming and ironing. There are so many better places in the neighborhood that won't ruin your clothes. Save your money and your clothes!

originalText.text:
the best dry cleaner in the neighborhood, hands down! I don’t trust anyone else with my garments and can always count on a reasonably quick turnaround time for cleaning. If your new to the area, or just looking for a dry cleaner you can count on for a quality product
great customer service experience, look no further!

originalText.text:
I left a black scarf and my beige jacket
They did not do a good job at all.  However, when I complained about it they did not hesitate to return money when I asked for it.

originalText.text:
I asked them to repair a hem, and re-attach the lining to the coat where it was needed. They did NOT repair the hem, and cut what tacking remained and left the pieces. This is a vintage camel hair coat.
My other vintage coat, where I asked them to get rid of the stains, they did NOT.
